Description: Small scarab in glazed composition, probably mould-made; underside decorated with standing hippopotamus-headed goddess Taweret with one outstreched arm holding long knife and to right a hieroglyphic sign (probably a sA-sign meaning "protection"), above neb-basket sign.
Curator's comments: Scarab not yet located, published by Petrie (Petrie 1886, pl. XXXVII, no. 114). The motif of Taweret holding a knife above the hieroglyphic sign of protection (sA) is well attested on scarabs (see for example Hornung and Staehelin 1976, 327, pl. 76, no. 690 with additional bibliography). Hornung, E., Staehelin, E. 1976. Skarabäen und andere Siegelamulette aus Basler Sammlungen, Ägyptische Denkmäler in der Schweiz I. Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I, 1884–5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXVII, no. 114)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OC.072) (phase 3)
